questions.question: Why did the Proclamation Act anger the colonists

choices.answer: It did not allow sugar or molasses in the colonies
It taxed tea, lead, paint, & glass
It did not allow settlement west of the Appalachians
It prohibited town meetings in the Northern colonies

questions.question: What event is being pictured here?
Why was the Proclamation Line created?

choices.answer: To stop colonists and Native Americans from fighting
To stop colonists from trading with the French
The colonists were not paying taxes on sugar and paper
Colonists were tarring and feathering tax collectors

questions.question: What act did Parliament pass to get the colonists under control after the Boston Tea Party?
What was the effect of colonial boycotts?

choices.answer: It made Parliament repeal the Proclamation Act
It persuaded Britain to change their policies
It was ignored byt he British
It widened divisions between colonists creating disharmony.

questions.question: How did Britain punish the colonies for the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: Banned colonists from settling west of the Appalachians
Redcoats fired into a crowd of colonists killing five people
Closing Boston Harbor which restricted the town's trade
By removing taxes on lead, glass, paint, and tea

questions.question: Why did Parliament pass the Sugar Act after the French and Indian War?

choices.answer: To pay the Indians for helping the French
To repay Indians for lives and supplies they lost
To repay money Britain owed to France
To repay the nation's war debt and military costs

questions.question: Which method was the most effective protest for the Stamp Act?
Why do some colonists oppose being taxed by the British Parliament?

choices.answer: They felt Britain had enough money
They felt  they didn't have a voice in tax policy
They were upset because they had to house British soldiers
They were upset because they  paid 1/4 of British taxes

questions.question: Which of the following protested tax with violence, threats, and intimidation?
Which of the following protest British policy by making items being boycotted?
How are primary sources supposed to be used to examine events?

choices.answer: Confuse the audience researching the event
Gather false information to convict a person
To tell only one side of a story

questions.question: Which of the following would carry a sign protesting British Policy?

choices.answer: Both a Patriot and a Fence Sitter

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul Revere's print titled "Bloody Massacre"?

choices.answer: It convinced the British that the Americans were serious
It convinced colonists that the British were ruthless rulers
It convinced colonists the British were too strong to fight
It made many colonists support British policy

questions.question: Which of the following did not protect all British citizens' rights?
Which of the following organized Natives and captured many of Britain's western forts?
Who organized committees of correspondence to keep colonists informed of British polices?
Which act was not passed to pay off war debts or run the empire?
Which acts put a tax on imported lead, glass, paint, paper and tea?
